text: Hi All, I'm working on the CMS certification.  I'm stuck on the navigation.  From one perspective it looks very simple to add, and from another, it's pages of code.  I've looked through all the various pages regarding menus, and have been studying the boilerplate code.  Is there some place that explains the macro?  More to the point perhaps, is navigation only added via a module?  Thanks for the help.

Hi Anna. For the CMS certification, you don't have to implement any sort of complex navigation. I even just hardcoded my nav items when I did my practicum. So, as long as you address all of the items in the instructions, you'll be good.
If you did want to read more about how to implement menus, I would check out this doc: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/menus-and-navigation#displaying-menus>
The boilerplate uses a custom module that uses the menu() function and custom macro to generate the nav. But, again, no need to implement something like that if you're only wanting to get certified.
Ah, it seemed pretty complicated for the certification so I'm glad I asked.  And, yes, I'm trying to get certified.  Thank you for the info.  I will check out the link.
Yes, this page is familiar!  I will work on this another time.  Thanks again for the help.  Anna
